article:
Honestly, I'm not a big fan of K-pop itself. However, if you see K-pop as a   _  , things get more   _  .
First, the process of 48 _  a K-pop singer, mostly through forming boy/girl groups, is like car production: Industrialize and focus on   _  . Talent agencies find potential   _  , often through global auditions . The training of the future stars, who are taught to sing and dance, act and learn foreign languages, can   _   three to seven years.
In the South Korean model, a pop   _   is more like a brand than a proper band. For instance, SM Entertainment's Super Junior boasts 12 members. This allows the company to break the band down into sub-units targeting   _   markets, including Super Junior-M (Mandarin pop music), Super Junior-T (trot music, a   _   of Korean music   _   back to the early 1900s), and something called Super Junior-Happy.
The pace of the K-pop music production is   _  . You get one   _   that can last for a week, and that's it. The record labels always want something   _   out of artists, in order to sell more music, as well as draw more   _  . So it makes   _   why South Korean singers are under   _   amounts of pressure.
But   _  , there is good news for K-pop fans. If you're a K-pop fan, you're really getting 63 _  in a community of people. They all like the same band as you; you all get to know the same thing, and it becomes a   _  . So maybe that's why everyone's so   _  .
